frameDefinitions: A member or members of a Class have just been  mentioned or are present in the discourse setting and now a different instance  (or group of instances) of the same class is referred to.
The Authorities put a Prisoner in Prison as punishment for an Offense.
This frame contains general words denoting equipment where the Use or purpose is not specified by the lexeme but (typically) by a separate expression.
This frame contains transparent nouns (and some adjectives) denoting quantities of a Mass or of Individuals.
A Resisting_entity is capable of resisting or does resist a physical Opposing_force to a level specified by the target.
An Item is located on a Scale relative to a critical value which is determined by some Enabled_situation.
frameExamples: My husband left me for <t>another</t> woman -- and now wants to get back together again!
US Drug Researcher <t>Imprisoned</t> for FDA Fraud.
He found them in the <t>deluge</t> of papers on his desk.
The great and <t>impregnable</t> fortress still stands today.
listRoleDefinitions: The general category of entity which has been referred to.
The instance of the <fen>Class</fen> that is added to the <fen>Initial_set</fen> of entities in the <fen>Class</fen>.
The previously mentioned group of entities of the <fen>Class</fen>.
The person who is confined in a penal institution.
The <fen>Prison</fen>  within which the <fen>Prisoner</fen> comes to be confined.
The <fen>Authorities</fen> are the institution or actors carrying out the imprisonment.
The time when the imprisonment happens.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Prisoner</fen> is kept.
The complex artifact with a particular use.
A substance that is being quantified.
The <fen>Resisting_entity</fen> is the item that resists the <fen>Opposing_force</fen> to the level specified by the target.

The <fen>Opposing_force</fen> is the item placed in opposition to the <fen>Resisting_entity</fen>. <fen>Opposing_force</fen> hinders, blocks, helps, or allows (lets) the <fen>Resisting_entity</fen> to resist at the level specified by the target. Sometimes this Core role is incorporated in the target; otherwise, it is often null instantiated in example sentences.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Resisting_entity</fen> resists an external force.
The location where the <fen>Resisting_entity</fen> resists an external force.
The entity whose scalar property is specified.
The <fen>Scale</fen> is the attribute of the <fen>Item</fen> that is being described.
This role identifies the <fen>Enabled_situation</fen> by which the critical value is judged.
listRoleExamples: My Husband left me for another <fex>man</fex>!
A further five incursions <fex>over and above those noted for 1995</fex> took place in the first three months of 1996.
<fex>Man</fex> Falsely Imprisoned for 24 Years Seeks Damages
When she returned, <fex>the Chaoyang Town government authorities</fex> imprisoned her for 5 days.
A modicum <fex>of seepage on the floor</fex> is to be expected.
A number <fex>of concerned citizens</fex> have raised objections.
These are made from a tough <fex>plastic foam</fex> and are very light to wear.
The fortress was impregnable <fex>to attack by hostile invaders</fex>.
The retaining wall was even weaker <fex>yesterday</fex>, and had begun to crumble.
They decided the tree-house would be sturdiest <fex>in the big old backyard oak</fex>.
It was <fex>hot</fex> enough to ignite the iron.
Can He make a rock too heavy <fex>for Him to lift</fex>?

passageCandidateSpans.text: the Connecticut State Retirement and Trust Fund

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure
